byline.original: By MIREYA NAVARRO and KIM BARKER

abstract: Ephraim Vashovsky, Adam Cohen and Shaoul Ohana, owner, manager and contractor of East Harlem apartment building, are charged with reckless endangerment, endangerment of child and other offenses related to negligence at property; city also announces $3.3 million lawsuit against men.

headline.print_headline: Landlord Accused of Harassing Residents Is Arrested
headline.main: Landlord Accused of Harassing Tenants Is Arrested

snippet: Ephraim Vashovsky, whose companies own over two dozen residential buildings in New York, was indicted, along with his manager and a contractor, on charges of reckless endangerment and other offenses....
lead_paragraph: Ephraim Vashovsky, whose companies own over two dozen residential buildings in New York, was indicted, along with his manager and a contractor, on charges of reckless endangerment and other offenses.
